A few months ago, Minecraft's original console developer 4J Studios showed off a new in-house engine they had created, called the Elements Engine. Now they've announced what game they're making with it. It's called Reforj, and it's an "open-world multiplayer survival sandbox." But it's not aiming to be Minecraft 2, they say.

 
Read more
articles.title: Minecraft console developer 4J Studios are making Reforj, their own open world survival game

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
GTA Online is no longer officially supported by Steam Deck, thanks to the introduction of some anti-cheat software which can, in fact, be made compatible with Steam Deck. Say what now?
 
Read more
articles.title: GTA Online is no longer supported by Steam Deck thanks to a slightly baffling Rockstar anti-cheat update

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Fifteen months on from its PS5 release, Final Fantasy XVI – that actiony RPG of emo-fringed hack ‘n’ slashing and disquietingly sexy Ralph Ineson characters – is now on PC. Enough time, you’d think, to do a proper job of rejigging it with Windows spanners, especially after Final Fantasy XV’s port got so much stick for its lack of features and performance issues.
FFVXI does make some improvements, adopting a full set of DLSS and FSR upscalers and frame generators, and its mouse and keyboard integration feels generally slicker than XV. Sadly, it’s still no first-rate adaptation, neglecting numerous PC features and giving low-end systems an even deeper kick in the plums. Cutting the quality settings can help, as per the guide down below, but overall performance is so up-and-down than you’ll likely never achieve a perfectly smooth ride.
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy XVI is an uneven PC port with performance to match

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Rather sheepishly, I must admit that my own experience with Armenian art begins and ends with System Of A Down. Cheers then, The Bird Of A Thousand Voices, for showing up in my inbox and giving me a second reference point next to Sugar. This one’s a simple though very striking platformer, inspired by folk legends and scored by composer Tigran Hamasyan. It’s part of a multimedia project based Armenian folk tale Hazaran Blbul (Firebird). It’s completely free, and you can find it here.
Read more
articles.title: The Bird Of A Thousand Voices is a simple, free and striking platformer weaving Armenian folk legends and fairy tales

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The mad lads at Square Enix have released a demo for their remake of 90s RPG Romancing SaGa 2: Revenge Of The Seven, in which you play a whole dynasty of customisable protagonists fighting vengeful ancient heroes. It’s a turn-based battler with an empire-building component in which you play as several emperors in succession, passing on abilities and knowledge to your heir. In what I consider to be a poetic complementary flourish, you can also pass on save data from the demo to the full game. Look, this is what counts as “poetic” just before lunch on a Thursday. 
 Read more
articles.title: Here’s a demo for the Square Enix RPG remake that sounds a bit like anime Crusader Kings

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
How many bones have you broken? It sucks, the snapping sound they make is impolite. I prefer to break virtual, non-corporeal bones. Slackers: Carts Of Glory looks like a co-conspirator in this endeavour. It's basically that one bit in Jackass where the gang blast downhill in shopping trollies at great risk to their bodily and mental health, as is their wont. The arcade racing game came out yesterday and features online multiplayer, so you can break someone else's bones too. Let's see it in action.
Read more
articles.title: Revisit the shopping trolley pain of Jackass in racing game Slackers: Carts Of Glory

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
“Guided by your moral compass: reflect on themes of home, loneliness and belonging through a complex, three-act story told effortlessly through three hours of video game narrative,” the press release for cat simulator Copycat told me. Morals? Daddy Karch, it’s happening again!
Read more
articles.title: Copycat forced me to refuse a dying elderly woman emotional comfort, then steal her chicken

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Lethal Company was one of last year's surprise horror hits. It was a brilliant dystopian scavenging sim in which you searched cellars for bolts while avoiding the attentions of creatures that hate being looked at, or which only move when they're not being looked at, or which look like your friends, from a distance. The developer's next game, Welcome To The Dark Place, is more about hearing. It's an "open-world, auditory text-based adventure" which mostly takes place in pitch blackness.
 
Read more
articles.title: The Lethal Company developer's next game is an open world where you can't see

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Just when you thought it was safe to go back into the Palwoods and hunt large, electric yellow animals of entirely original design whose names rhyme with "peekaboo", Nintendo and The Pokémon Company have announced that they're taking Palworld developers Pocketpair to court for "infringement of patent rights". 

 
Read more
articles.title: Nintendo and The Pokémon Company are suing the Palworld developers for "infringement of patent rights"

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
Farm life sim snowclone My Time At X is getting a third entry. My Time At Evershine looks to feature more sowing, reaping, kissing and combat, similar to the previous games My Time At Portia and My Time At Sandrock, but with a new art style, campaign co-op and citybuilding elements. You'll get a glimpse of the new art style in the announcement trailer below.

 
Read more
articles.title: My Time At Evershine promises to bring a new art style and expanded co-op to the farming life sim

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
I don't think I'm going out on a limb by saying that Ubisoft's best game of this year won't be Star Wars Outlaws or the as-yet unreleased Assassin's Creed Shadows, it'll be Prince Of Persia: The Lost Crown. The sidescrolling metroidvania is a rich, expansive, and surprisingly challenging take on a genre typically dominated by indies, and it's precisely the kind of game I wish mega-publishers produced more.

It's also now got a story expansion, Mask Of Darkness, which came out yesterday.

 
Read more
articles.title: Prince Of Persia: The Lost Crown's story DLC Mask Of Darkness is out now

articles.author: Graham Smith
articles.description:
We don't write much about board and paper games around these parts, not since Cardboard Children was sent to the dissolving pits. I still feel that roleplay and strategy gaming has a home here on RPS even when it's not digital though, and doubly so when it's the work of our former comrades.

Enter Gold Teeth, a tabletop RPG "of piracy & occult horror" which just cleared its Kickstarter funding goal, and which is designed by Marsh Davies and Jim Rossignol (RPS in peace).

 
Read more
articles.title: Gold Teeth is a tabletop RPG about "piracy and occult horror" from RPS pals Jim Rossignol and Marsh Davies

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Yesterday I watched a Youtube video about Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2, in which sundry, gesticulating milords of the internet opine that they had "forgot what it's like to be the target audience" for games, hailing the new (and for our money, fairly good) Warhammer 40K shooter as a throwback affair that "oozes masculinity", with no excess feelings or real-life social relevancy. I then combed through several thousand comments below said video, many of which expressed similar longing for the hypothetical Good Old Days, before those wily feminists invaded the medium, transformed every game into a LGBT+ weeping simulator, and threw all the Real Men into a big hole. I did this because I was searching for one particular comment written by somebody claiming to be Matthew Karch, CEO of Space Marine 2 developers Saber Interactive. 

 
Read more
articles.title: Saber won't say whether their CEO wrote this highly baity comment about games "imposing morals on gamers"

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
As I’m sure as is the curse of anyone who’s watched the entirety of Peep Show multiple times, I cannot read the name ‘Marko’ without hearing it in a nasally Australian accent, inquiring about cocaine. This is probably a disservice to the hero of colourful metroidvania Marko: Beyond Brave, who a quick goog tells me may be based on Krali Marko - a popular character in the folklore of Studio Mechka’s native Bulgaria. Folk hero or not, Marko certainly has some heroic facial hair: his moustache floweth so bountifully that it can’t be contained in his character portrait. Extremely powerful of him.
Read more
articles.title: Metroidvania Marko: Beyond Brave describes itself as "Slavic Silksong", and is out now

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
As per EA’s recent generative AI tugathon, the third game in Respawn’s action adventure Star Wars trilogy has been confirmed again to be in development. According to EA, it’ll be the “final chapter" in the now-trilogy, following 2019’s Jedi Fallen Order and 2023’s Jedi Survivor.
The existence of the game was first confirmed by Cal Kestis actor Cameron Monaghan, during an Ocala Comic Con panel. “We’re working on a third and we’re in the process of doing that right now,” said Monaghan, which is about as straightforward an affirmative as one could want. It was also double-confirmed this February, following news of layoffs at EA, via Eurogamer.
Read more
articles.title: EA confirm that Respawn’s next Star Wars Jedi game will be the series’ “final chapter”

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
The upcoming skate. game now has an (admittedly vague) early access release date of 2025, according to a post by the developers on Xitter. It's difficult to write about the new skate. game because if you choose to write skate. with the imposed stylings which skate. publishers Electronic Arts insist, you end up putting a full stop after every instance of skate., which makes your sentences about skate. sound fucking stupid. and. belaboured. with. pauses. Game makers, please stop putting punctuation in your game names.
Read more
articles.title: Skate heelflips into my calendar with an early access release some time in 2025

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
People waiting impatiently for The Sims 5: you have sinned against Simming and must do penance. In your temerity and ignorance, you have cried out unto developers Maxis and publisher EA for another sequential helping of the cuddly/sociopathic neighbourhood-building game - a "sequel", if you will. Know ye not that we live in the time of Disrupted Models? Sequels are archaisms devised by the old gods in their dotage. Let us all join hands and set forth into the sunny uplands of the Connected Cross-Media Cross-Platform Universe.
 
Read more
articles.title: There shall be no Sims 5, you insolent fools, only a Sims universe

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Having gone to bed last night with Final Fantasy XVI installed yet unplayed on a Steam Deck, I awoke to find Valve have slapped the moody RPG with Unsupported status for the handheld. Its crime: an inability to "run well" on the Steam Deck’s internals, regardless of settings changes. Dammit, Clive.
Read more
articles.title: Final Fantasy XVI’s wobbly Steam Deck performance gets it a failing grade from Valve

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
What are you LYMBUS? In what vat were you grown? I feel like I’ve sluggishly ambled my way down to the fridge and tried to scoop a gherkin from the jar, only to find a disconcertingly tasty sliver of my own brain - like a creature from Flatland trying to play 4D chess, and all the pieces are just tiny carvings of my face with “lol get a load of this prick” whittled into the forehead. I quite like it.
“We combined your favorite genres into one grotesque piece of software! You're welcome, game journalists,” reads the Steam page for the demo. That is a very polite way to kick me in the head and call me a bitch, LYMBUS.
Read more
articles.title: LYMBUS is hostile to my existence and keeps demanding brain cells I haven’t grown yet

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
It's been long suspected (if not officially confirmed) that the first Red Dead Redemption will be getting a PC remaster some time in the near future. We've already seen a description for the PC version appear briefly on the PlayStation store (of all places). And earlier this year a snoopy fan of the studio who monitors the backend of Rockstar's launcher found similar game descriptions buried amid metadata. Yesterday, that same practice yielded yet another clue - the game's Steam app number.
Read more
articles.title: Rockstar leak more clues of a Red Dead Redemption PC remaster

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Last month, Helldivers 2 studio Arrowhead thrust a white flag out from their shelled position in an attempt to placate mutinous fans of the co-op shooter. In response to a community sentiment best summed up by a popular Reddit post titled “Let the super earth burn”, Arrowhead released a statement. “In short, we didn’t hit our target with the latest update…what matters most now is action. Not talk.” Said action (which, it must be pointed out, felt a bit troublingly reactive to the loudest and most histrionic voices in the roo..uh, subreddit) was foreshadowed in a list of issues to be tackled over the coming months.
Read more
articles.title: You're now much stronger against tanks and armour in Helldivers 2, as Arrowhead patch for "more versatile" tactics

articles.author: Sin Vega
articles.description:
Frostpunk 2 was an ambitious gambit. With survival achieved, and the introduction's excellently sinister advisor whispering evil Tory ideas, the whole city you built in Frostpunk is now just the headquarters for a sprawling expansion effort, and your rule is no longer absolute. Rather than retread the same "prepare for ultra-Winter" ground, your biggest obstacle will likely be your own people, now formed into shifting political parties, and looking outward with colonial eyes. The result is a complicated, laborious survival citybuilder that's two parts compelling, and one part frustrating for the wrong reasons.
Read more
articles.title: Frostpunk 2 review: I became a dictator because everyone was so goddamn annoying

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
As the end of the UK workday approaches, and the last few grains of sand trickle through the neck of the huge, obsidian hourglass our overlord Graham keeps on his desk, let me bid you goodbye by writing up Some Goodbyes We Made. 
Read more
articles.title: Some Goodbyes We Made is a collection of sorrowfully sweet games about saying goodbye

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
I really wanted to like action adventure The Plucky Squire more than I do now, having given its charming 2D to 3D platforming a proper whirl. Yes, it's lovely to look at. Yes, hopping out of a storybook and making friends with an illustration on a coffee mug is cool. And yes, everyone can have a mildly fun time with its puzzles and fights. But that's the problem: who is everyone? At first I thought, "This game is for young kids and that's fine!", given its relative simplicity. Then I hit some puzzles and thought, "Ain't no kid figuring this out".
Then it hit me. It struggles to balance the fine line between being approachable for tiny tots and layered enough for people who've graduated from "goo goo ga ga" to "oo oo aa aa my back hurts". And that's down to how plucky you're allowed to squire at any given time, because it can be surprisingly limited and, sadly, a bit underwhelming.
Read more
articles.title: The Plucky Squire review: a charming storybook adventure, but I wish it let you go full plucko mode

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
You can't travel back to the 1980s. But what if I told you it was possible to gently warp your memories of that time? UFO 50 is a kart of 50 games that once existed for an old computer system, all lovingly restored by a gang of coders. The old console, of course, is a fiction. The LX-I never existed. But it's a fun pseudo-history against which to create a grab bag of small games (some throwaway, others mighty) all designed with a distinct 80s look. It's an exercise in adhering to an aesthetic. Like an oil painter working with a limited range of colours, the developers of this bundle have stuck to a 32-colour equivalent of the Zorn palette. Yet play a little of each game, and you start to sense the smirk of chronos. These games aren't stuck in the past, but they are enjoying a holiday there. 
Read more
articles.title: UFO 50 review: a pixellated portrait of the 1980s that offers a strange sort of time travel

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
Having played the opening hour of Altus’ Metaphor: ReFantazio – now mere weeks away from its October 11th launch – I think it’s high time to correct a games previewing injustice. Namely, that the majority of its pre-release buzz has centred around its proximity to Persona, and not its far more entertaining quality of having the most gleefully bizarre RPG enemy design this side of Elden Ring’s horn-tooting orbpeople.
Read more
articles.title: Metaphor: ReFantazio almost has me sold on its bonkers bad guy designs alone

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Why is every blockbuster video game now some kind of live service game? Speaking as a clueless idiot, the explanation I find most convincing is that it's an attempt to bridge the gap between the returns publishers want from video games, versus how much we're able or willing to pay upfront. "Triple-A" projects now cost exorbitant sums to develop, partly thanks to wider economic inflation, but also because publishers have spent decades teaching players that every sequel has to be More and Shinier. Premium game prices have not risen in proportion, and investors want growth, as they do.
Live service games sneak around this difficulty by dragging out the time we spend playing them. Whether premium or free-to-play, they seek to install themselves as habits by means of regular, planned updates and additions. This is time that can be monetised by way of a subscription model, time in which other products may be sold to you, like skins and paintjobs, and time that becomes a commodity in itself, "engagement", which can be transmuted and exploited to various end. I'm not sure it's ever been expressed this way in any press release boast about longevity, but the unspoken principle/logical extrapolation seems to be that ideally, a live service game should keep us plugged in and plugging away till we die.
 Read more
articles.title: We should redefine live service games as the living dead

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Strange Scaffold’s newly released FPS I Am Your Beast is very fun for quite a few reasons, but chief among them is a deep appreciation for the poetry of good videogame violence. I’m not using the big P word just to throw out an overly worthy comparison to something we might associate with craft or beauty, but as a nod toward the game’s playful application of what I previously called ‘a euphoric splurge of murderous game verbiage’ one morning where I had clearly eaten my wordy Weetabix. The way its hurled knives and curb stomps and inexplicable decapitations flow together have an assonant, almost Suessian quality to them.
But it’s also, well, just a bit like Mad Libs. You play as Harding, a man who’s mythical lethality is established very early on. The showing is there in the moment to moment, but the telling is conveyed through cute tricks like how everyone you meet is so deeply afraid of Harding that they loudly keep track of exactly what weapon he’s holding at all times. The Mad Libs comes in through the fact that you can draw Harding a route between A and B, and it’s a given that multiple heads are going to come unstuck from necks along the way. You’re sort of just casually filling in the verbs that seem the most fun to you in the moment. One of the verbs is ‘hornet’. Hornet is a verb now.
Read more
articles.title: People’s heads keep exploding for no good reason in I Am Your Beast and I’m very much onboard with it

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
I started playing and enjoying battle royale wizarding sim Spellbreak just in time for Spellbreak to get shut down. Developers Proletariat, Inc announced plans to yank the servers back in August 2022 in the course of being acquired by Activision Blizzard, bringing an end to many happy hours spent skating on conjured ice ramps and hurling boulders around like bunny rabbits. Yes, I am the kind of wizard who hurls a bunny rabbit, if there are no boulders to spare.
Happily, it transpires that Proletariat have resurrected their creation and handed it over to posterity in the shape of a free standalone Community Version, available on Itch.io. You’ll need to host your own server or join another group if you want to play multiplayer, but all the same, this is a lovely gift and one I’m delighted to transmit unto you, the active and efficient Magenauts of Rockus Paperus Shottegonne.
 Read more
articles.title: I completely missed that ace wizard battle royale Spellbreak had been brought back from the dead

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Having shot up the near-future in Battlefield 2042, DICE and EA are using a modern-day setting with the next instalment of their military FPS series. According to EA studios group general manager and Respawn chief Vince Zampella, the new, currently untitled shooter will be one of those "back to basics" sequels that tries to rebottle the lightning of Battlefield 3 and Battlefield 4 - these being the "peak" Battlefield games, in Zampella's view.

 
Read more
articles.title: The next Battlefield is a return to the "peak era" of Battlefields 3 and 4, with a modern setting and smaller headcounts

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
I am sure gladiator roguelike RPG We Who Are About To Die’s latest update is very nice, and its accompanying 30% celebratory discount even nicer. You can find the full patch notes here, and I’d be interested to hear how significant they are from the more fascina-pilled among you. They mean nothing to me, however, because We Who Are About To Die has been taunting me from my wishlist since it launched in early access a few years back. Well, no more. Throw me to the lions! Oh, this one has a Steam demo in its mouth. Great stuff.
 
Read more
articles.title: We Who Are About To Die’s new update has finally given me the excuse I need to cowardly lob some rocks at the heads of seasoned opponents

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
ECHOSTASIS is the third entry in Enigma’s Studio’s horror trilogy, and it’s one of the more interesting games I’ve played this year. There’s a demo on Steam, and you should grab it if you're interested, since everything I have to say about it is going to be a spoiler of some kind. I’ll attempt a brief description below, but a lot of the fun here is discovering how all its parts fit together, and how even its more prosaic game conventions are defamiliarised through a spooky, static-drenched ensorcellment.
Read more
articles.title: ECHOSTASIS’s curious and thoughtful horror doesn’t overlook the importance of an excellent shotgun

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
In theory, vampires and immersive sims go together as naturally as bats and caves. Immersive sims tend to involve a balance of stealth, acrobatics, raw strength and crafty manipulation, and vampires are celebrated for all of these things. Despite this, actual vampire-themed immersive sims are rare. My list starts with Vampire: the Masquerade: Bloodlines... and sort of ends there. In a devastating betrayal, Arkane Austin's Redfall wasn't an immersive sim but an open world co-op shooter (a not very good one). The much-delayed Bloodlines 2 was recently downgraded from immersive sim to RPG by new developers The Chinese Room. Arkane Lyon's Blade adaptation seems promising, but it's a ways off. 


Here to paper over the immersive vamping gap in the market is Byte Barrel's Trust, "a new first-person shooter with immersive sim elements". It takes place in a world where the vampires are hunted for their blood, which has become an everyday human energy source, used for everything from car batteries to streetlights. The irony! I feel like, in the circumstances, the ideal solution would be for humans to let vampires suck their blood in return for vampires letting humans use their blood for electricity, but that wouldn't make for a very thrilling shooter. Anyway, here's the trailer.
 
Read more
articles.title: Trust is a vampire FPS with immersive sim elements from the Forgive Me Father devs

articles.author: James Archer
articles.description:
If you’ve played Battle Brothers, you’ll know that Overhype Studios have a way of making you care for an underling, no more so than when you inadvertently send them onto the wrong end of a sharp blade. Menace, their upcoming turn-based tactical RPG, will also put the wellbeing of your chosen fighters at the forefront of your mind – along with a dramatic shift from 2D medieval sprites to the fully 3D battlefields of a unruly space frontier.
Read more
articles.title: Menace’s turn-based battles are the galaxy’s deadliest teambuilding exercises

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
To survive in looter-booter Pacific Drive you have to keep the paranormal station wagon you drive around in good nick. You're constantly repairing corroded doors and swapping out busted engine parts with cobbled-together technology. But maybe this tinkering was a little too much. Our review praised the game for its "trunk loads of atmosphere" but called the constant need to craft stuff "laborious". If you also felt this, then good news. An update now lets you fiddle the difficulty options a generous amount, say developers Ironwood Studios, making the game easier and bringing crafting needs right down.
Buuut... if you thought the opposite - that the game wasn't hard enough - you can now tick a box that makes hitting yourself with the trunk door kill you stone dead.
Read more
articles.title: Closing the car boot on your head will now kill you in Pacific Drive

articles.author: Ed Thorn
articles.description:
If you're a fan of rhythm games and fun bops, then you might want to bookmark ol' Hyperbeat. Set in a wireframe world, you're to chop, dodge or ride notes as you slam your "hyperknight" through a tunnel at high speed. There's a subtle, dreamy story element to your musical journey, with confusing dialogue and a nice cherry blossom tree. Hmmm, curious. Anyway yeah, it looks rad.
Read more
articles.title: Neon knight flier Hyperbeat looks like a stylish mash-up of Rez and Osu!

articles.author: Christian Donlan
articles.description:
Tiny Glade has been a constant presence on TikTok for the last year or so. It's never far away. In between burrito recipes and hymns to the Fujifilm X100v, this gorgeous toylike art tool's gamely turning stretches of balmy meadow into semi-ruined castles, semi-ruined villages and semi-ruined citadels. 
Dreamy and slightly haunted, it's conjured words like "bewitching" and "spellbinding" in the comments sections, too. It makes sense, really. Tiny Glade's a game about making rustic dioramas and then photographing them. It's not hard to imagine some exiled magical person might live in here among the rocks and reeds and wild heather.
Read more
articles.title: Tiny Glade review: lovely tools and procedural flourishes make building castles a treat

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Alruna And The Necro-Industrialists opens with paired quotes from T.S. Eliot's The Wasteland and Mad Max: Fury Road - a blend of influences that would typically get you kicked out of the Creative Writing Club for being simultaneously too fancy and too obvious, but the game beyond the epigraph looks pretty swish.
It's "a compact and high-density Metroidvania, with a focus on sequence-breaking and playing things out of order". It uses a square aspect display ratio calibrated to give wizened Game Boy enthusiasts the shakes, and is made up of 200 single-screen rooms that "slot into the larger puzzle-box of the world". Also, you play a thorn witch who looks a bit like 1950s Tinkerbell, with a touch of Betty Boop. Here's a trailer.
 Read more
articles.title: In handsome metroidvania Alruna And The Necro-Industrialists you are a dryad fighting the corpse of capitalism

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Efforts to render Mars commuter-friendly proceed apace as Mars First Logistics embraces the magic of trains. The latest update for the physics-based open world build-a-car game introduces a mountable theodolite, which lets you stitch together monorail networks you can then ride about on.
If monorails strike you as frivolous, don't worry. It's more of a Shelbyville idea. And in any case, the theodolite also lets you construct networks of pipes, power lines and rail-less tarmac roads - the ready-salted crisp of the road family. It’s a chonky expansion that, in the words of lead developer Ian MacLarty, has only “scratched the surface of where this new system could go”. I am predicting an eventual pivot into either themepark management or factory simulator.

 
Read more
articles.title: Mars First Logistics has turned into a Martian railway builder, with some very pretty, 100% authentic clouds

articles.author: Matt Cox
articles.description:
I am lost in my own factory. From every direction, every angle, conveyor belts and smelters and assemblers obscure my senses and envelop my being. Twenty hours ago I placed my first manufacturer somewhere around here. Back then it represented the state of the art, hatching me a pristine batch of 1.25 computers every minute - now I’ve forgotten where I put the damn thing, after delving into my factory’s guts to hook that piddly yet still useful batch of old relics up to my main production line. I’m building supercomputers now, and the many manufacturers that make those are hungry.
Something is always hungry in Satisfactory, and that hunger pulls you from task to task in a near-seamless and frankly beautiful daze of ever-escalating industry. It is mesmerising and it is fearsome, and after five years of early access it’s finally complete.
Read more
articles.title: Satisfactory 1.0 review: yes, it is

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Happy this week, everybody! The squirrels are trying to kill me. There's a massive horse chestnut tree outside my flat, and whenever I walk under it they drop conkers on my head. The squirrels are clearly Maw cultists. They want to give me a concussion and choke off the supply of video game news to the Maw, which will then manifest fully and bring about an age of darkness. Well, the joke's on you, squirrels, because I used to play grass hockey as a kid and I've been hit in the head by hard round objects a million times over. How else do you explain my choice of career? Anyway, here's a curated list of PC games that are out in the next five days.
 Read more
articles.title: The Maw: what's new in PC games this week?

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Goichi 'Suda51' Suda - of No More Heroes and Killer7 fame - reckons a focus on Metacritic scores is bad for creativity. Speaking to GI.biz recently alongside survival horror genre maker-upper Shinji Mikami, Suda expressed his frustrations with the review aggregator platform’s cultural cache.
"Everybody pays too much attention to and cares too much about Metacritic scores. It's gotten to the point where there's almost a set formula – if you want to get a high Metacritic score, this is how you make the game," Suda51 told Gi.biz.
Read more
articles.title: Resident Evil and No More Heroes creators join long list of devs who think Metacritic is bad for game dev

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Ve světě PC máme jediného výrobce CPU, který stojí za řeč a jediného výrobce GPU, který dominuje trhu velkých hráčských karet. Křečovitě se drží jediný správný OS, zatímco jediný správný browser si poklidně kraluje.
articles.title: Pokračující monopolizace světa PC: kdo přijde další?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Satrapa)
articles.description: Typografické schopnosti webových prohlížečů zaznamenaly v uplynulých letech velký pokrok. Dnešní prohlížeče už umí věci, které byly ještě celkem nedávno vyhrazeny specializovaným programům.
articles.title: Písma na webu: rodina je základ písma

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Dokončíme popis blokových a řetězcových instrukcí, které jsou specifickým rysem instrukční sady Intel 8086/8088. Ukážeme si vliv směru přenosu dat a zaměříme se i na problematiku rychlosti provádění blokových operací.
articles.title: Specifika instrukční sady mikroprocesorů Intel 8086/8088 (3)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Václav Dvorský)
articles.description: Je mi jasné, že titulek může vypadat kontroverzně, ale věřte mi, myslím to úplně vážně. Před nějakým časem by to vypadalo jako nesmysl, nicméně doba se změnila. Právě o tom je tento článek.
articles.title: Stavíme herní počítač na Linuxu pro moderní hraní

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si představíme open-source konkurenta Cursoru, řekneme si o správci hesel pro GNOME, vyzkoušíme svobodný fork již nesvobodného Redisu a podíváme se na terminál pro kontejnery.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (25. 9. 2024)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Dnes si ukážeme, jak vytvořit neuronovou síť s volitelným počtem skrytých vrstev, naučit tuto síť řešit zvolený problém s využitím sady trénovacích dat a následně tuto síť použít nad další sadou (validačních) dat.
articles.title: Neuronové sítě v knihovně scikit-learn: vytvoření a učení malé sítě

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: CESNET CERTS)
articles.description: V dnešním díle Postřehů hrají v hlavních rolích neopatrné parsování XML souborů, VMware a jeho zranitelnosti či změny v zabezpečení přístrojů s Androidem. Nakonec budeme loupat cibuli – Tor.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: loupeme Tor s německou policií

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Tým AlmaLinux oznámil založení nové zájmové skupiny, která se bude zabývat certifikací hardwaru. Fedora 42 možná přejde na nový instalátor s webovým rozhraním. Stefano Marinelli zveřejnil návod, jak udělat operační systém NetBSD neměnným.
articles.title: AlmaLinux nabízí certifikaci hardwaru, Fedora 42 s webovým instalátorem

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Týden v KDE ve znamení čištění kódu pro budoucí verzi Plasmy 6.2(.1) a novinek pro Plasmu 6.3, SDL nově preferuje API Vulkan i na Windows místo Direct3D 12, vývojová verze Wine 9.18 řeší 18 chyb.
articles.title: Qualcomm chce koupit Intel, KDE čistí kód příští verze Plasmy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Svatopluk Vít)
articles.description: Linux beru jako systém s vysokou mírou zabezpečení pro denní použití. Poslední dobou se stále častěji setkávám s pojmem „immutable Linux“ a mnoha články na toto téma. Proč se o tom tolik hovoří a co to přesně přináší?
articles.title: Neměnný operační systém: odolný útokům nebo uživatelům?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vývojáři uvolnili očekávaný PostgreSQL 17 s řadou vylepšení a nových funkcí. Detaily jsme popisovali už v květnu v článku PostgreSQL 17: pádící slon nezpomalí. Mezi hlavní novinky patří nový systém správy paměti pro VACUUM, který snižuje spotřebu paměti a může zlepšit celkový výkon vysávání.
articles.title: PostgreSQL 17 zlepšuje výkon při čtení i zápisech

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Novou kritickou zranitelnost linuxových systémů objevil a nahlásil Simone Margaritelli, odborník na počítačovou bezpečnost s přezdívkou EvilSocket. Společnosti Canonical a Red Hat už problém potvrdily a ohodnotily jeho nebezpečnost na 9,9 z 10 na stupnici závažnosti CVSS.
articles.title: Kritická zranitelnost linuxových systémů dostala hodnocení CVSS 9.9, oprava zatím neexistuje

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Projekt Vanilla OS zveřejnil příspěvek na blogu, ve kterém odpovídá na otázky, které uživatelé vznesli po vydání Vanilla OS 2. Příspěvek obsahuje informace o plánech aktualizace systému, podnikové verzi s podporou a chystané experimentální verzi nazvané Vanilla OS Vision.
articles.title: Vanilla OS: plány, aktualizace a další verze

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Společnost Google tvrdí, že přechod na jazyky bezpečné pro paměť, jako je Rust, v rámci přístupu secure-by-design, vedl ke snížení zranitelností paměti v Androidu během šesti let ze 76 % na 24 % ze všech objevených zranitelností. Tato změna u nových funkcí nejen snižuje celkové bezpečnostní riziko, ale také umožňuje „škálovatelnější a nákladově efektivnější“ přechod.
articles.title: Přechod Androidu na Rust snížil počet zranitelností paměti za pět let na pětinu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Pokud vás zajímá decentralizovaná sociální síť Mastodon a lidé na ní, můžete se přidat ke druhému ročníku srazu uživatelů, který se bude konat v pátek 11. října 2024 od 17:30 v Praze v Hospůdce Do Větru (Na Větrníku 1930/1, Praha 6 – Břevnov). Můžete dorazit, ať už jste ve Fediverse nováček, nebo veterán.
articles.title: Druhý ročník srazu uživatelů Mastodon a Fediverse

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Vídeňská nezisková organizace Noyb (zkratka pro None Of Your Business) podala u rakouského úřadu pro ochranu osobních údajů (DPA) stížnost na tvůrce prohlížeče Firefox za to, že nasadil novou funkci nazvanou Privacy-Preserving Attribution (PPA), aniž by výslovně požádal uživatele o souhlas.
articles.title: Stížnost na Mozillu kvůli povolení sledování ve Firefoxu bez souhlasu uživatele

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Režisér Danny Boyle je znám experimentováním. Už první díl, 28 Days Later byl v roce 2002 natáčen primárně pomocí běžné 3CCD MiniDV kamery Canon XL-1, uvedené na trh v roce 1998, tedy v kvalitě odpovídající 480p (konkrétně 525 řádků, 60 Hz). To filmu propůjčilo unikátní punc už tehdy, natož optikou dnešní 8k doby.
articles.title: Danny Boyle točí 28 Years Later s iPhone 15 Pro Max

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nová verze linuxového nástroje pro aktualizaci firmwarů Fwupd 1.9.25 přináší další dílčí rozšíření podporovaných zařízení. Kromě toho tvůrci zapracovali na snížení spotřeby v klidu pro spárovaná zařízení typu Logitech HID++ a dalších opravách (kontrola velikosti firmwaru pro Synaptics MST, podpora retry operace u NVMe zařízení typu Hynix BC901, …).
articles.title: Fwupd 1.9.25 přidává podporu Intel USB4 hubu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Intel vydal novou generaci Xeonů Granite Rapids poodhalenou na konci léta a Phoronix rovnou přináší úvodní test 128jádrového modelu Xeon 6980P. Ve stručnosti shrnuje, že jej Intel s Granite Rapids (pozitivně) překvapil. Test přitom proběhl na referenční platformě dodané Intelem, s rychlými pamětmi MRDIMM-8800 (Multiplexed Rank DIMM).
articles.title: Intel Xeon Granite Rapids v prvních testech na Linuxu poráží AMD, ale ne nadlouho

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Švýcarsko učinilo významný krok k otevření svého software svým Federálním zákonem o používání elektronických prostředků pro plnění úkolů veřejné správy (EMBAG). Tento průlomový právní předpis nařizuje zveřejňování zdrojového kódu pro software vyvinutý pro vládní účely.
articles.title: Švýcarská federální vláda vyžaduje uvolnění zdrojových kódu u svého softwaru

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Kubernetes je dnes nejrozšířenější platformou na hostovaní Docker kontejnerů a je podporován velkými hráči na trhu (Google, Amazon, Microsoft) skrz Cloud Native Computing Foundation. Kuberneres pro provoz používají všechny velikosti firem, od startupu po korporace. Pojďme se naučit jej používat na dvoudenním kurzu Úvod do Kubernetes, který proběhne v naší pražské školicí místnosti ve dnech 14. a 15. října. Školení proběhne pouze online.
articles.title: Naučte se Kubernetes na našem dvoudenním školení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: V květnu Winamp oznámil, že otevře zdrojové kódy legendárního multimediálního přehrávače. Nyní se tak skutečně stalo a zdrojové kódy byly uvolněny na GitHubu. Winamp na svém oficiálním kanále na síti X říká, že uživatelé mají nyní možnost ovlivnit budoucnost svého oblíbeného přehrávače.  Zkoumejte, upravujte a rozvíjejte klasiku, kterou znáte a máte rádi.
articles.title: Winamp zveřejnil zdrojové kódy, ale pod podivnou licencí v rozporu s pravidly GitHubu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Po několika týdnech testování vydal Valve novou verzi balíku Proton, jím upraveného projektu Wine do snadno použitelné podoby integrované do Steamu. Mezi nově podporované hry se zařazují tituly jako Avatar: Frontiers of Pandora, Flatout 3, Syberia, Unity of Command II, Sleeping Dogs: Definitive Edition či Zaccaria Pinball.
articles.title: Valve Proton 9.0-3 přidává podporu nových her, opravuje desítky chyb

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Jak bylo před něolika dny avizováno, nyní se děje. Procesory Intel se už nebudou na Linuxu všechny tvářit jako příslušníci „Family 6“, rodiny sahající až do 90. let minulého století, první takovou bude architektura Diamond Rapids, která bude známa též jako „Family 19“.
articles.title: Intel Diamond Rapids už bude Family 19

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Projekt OpenZFS zařadil do kódu podporu Direct I/O (O_DIRECT) pro souborový systém ZFS, aby se při čtení a zápisu obešel ARC. Na zařazení kódu se čekalo od roku 2020, kdy byl vytvořen původní pull request.
articles.title: OpenZFS přidává podporu pro Direct I/O

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Po téměř 12 letech vývoje byla vydána verze 1.0.0 programovacího jazyka Hy, což je dialekt jazyka Lisp, který je zabudován do jazyka Python. Jedná se o první stabilní vydání tohoto jazyka. Čerstvě vydaná verze 1.0.0 podporuje Python 3.8 až 3.13. Proč jej používat, se dozvíte v dokumentaci a na stránce „Proč Hy?“.
articles.title: Hy 1.0.0: dialekt Lispu integrovaný do Pythonu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Generální ředitel společnosti Pavel Durov oznámil aktualizaci pravidel. Telegram vyhoví žádostem orgánů činných v trestním řízení, pokud se zjistí, že vyšetřovaný uživatel porušuje pravidla platformy. V takových případech pak bude Telegram poskytovat údaje uživatelů orgánům činným v trestním řízení v reakci na platné zákonné požadavky.
articles.title: Telegram bude poskytovat údaje o uživatelích orgánům činným v trestním řízení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Mirror Hall je experimentální implementace nástroje, který dovoluje proměnit libovolné linuxové zařízení v bezdrátový externí displej. Z vysokoúrovňového pohledu jde vlastně o kombinací bezdrátového streameru videa, síťového přehrávače videa a virtuálního zobrazovače pro prostředí GNOME.
articles.title: Mirror Hall: externí bezdrátový displej z libovolného linuxového zařízení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: johny)
articles.description: Minulý týždeň v utorok  vyšla najnovšia verzia Javy: Java 23. Dokumenty JEP 476 Module Import Declarations a JEP 477 Implicitly Declared Classes and Instance Main Methods opisujú zmeny, ktoré ďalej zjednodušujú tvorbu menších programov určených na výuku a testovanie.
articles.title: Java 23 ďalej zjednodušuje písanie malých programov

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Pořadatelé již osmého ročníku komunitního setkání správců nejen českých a slovenských sítí – CSNOG 2025, které se uskuteční 21. a 22. ledna, vyhlásili Call for Abstracts.
articles.title: Organizátoři síťařského setkání CSNOG 2025 vyhlásili Call for Abstracts

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Loki je nástroj na sběr, ukládaní a prohlížení logu. Je to nástroj od Grafany, takže je s ní přímo integrovaná. Připravili jsme pro vás nové školení Loki – Log management v Grafaně, na kterém se naučíte nasadit Loki Stack (Loki, Grafana a Promtail) a budete do něj schopni ukládat logy. Dále se naučíte, jak logy prohledávat, ukážeme si, jak nastavit retenci logu i jak nad daty z logu dělat dashboardy a alerting.
articles.title: Loki: log management v Grafaně (školeni)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Ve čtvrtek 3. října se v Red Hat Labu (místnost Q305) uskuteční další Fedora installfest. Od 10 do 16 hodin budou v labu připravení odborníci na Fedoru ze společnosti Red Hat, kteří vám můžou pomoct nejen s instalací, ale taky pomoct s dalšími problémy a dotazy ohledně Fedory.
articles.title: Fedora Installfest na FIT VUT v Brně

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Dmitry Grinberg před dvanácti lety nabootoval Linux na osmibitovém mikrořadiči AVR. Nyní se rozhodl posunout laťku ještě dál, tedy spíše zpět. Nabootoval Debian na čtyřbitovém procesoru Intel 4004, což je zároveň vůbec první mikroprocesor na světě – vznikl už v roce 1971.
articles.title: Linux na čtyřbitovém procesoru Intel 4004 z roku 1971

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Emma)
articles.description: Jedná se o korespondenční seminář, který organizují studenti a učitelé FIT ČVUT. V průběhu roku se můžete těšit na pět kol, ve kterých budete moci řešit jak programovací, tak teoretické úlohy.
articles.title: Začíná 11. ročník programovací soutěže pro středoškoláky FIKS

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Google aktualizuje svého správce hesel, který uživatelům umožňuje synchronizovat přístupové klíče Passkey v mnoha zařízeních používajících různé platformy. Doposud bylo možné ukládat hesla do správce hesel pouze v systému Android. Přihlášení pak sice bylo možné provést i na jiném zařízení, ale bylo k tomu potřeba stále použít Android a naskenovat QR kód.
articles.title: Google umí Passkey synchronizovat napříč zařízeními na různých platformách

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Golden: ve 2D se konečně podařilo připravit i zlato. Temná hmota mohla pomoci vytvořit supermasivní černé díry v raném vesmíru. Pozitronium ochladili téměř na absolutní nulu.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Konsorcium LUMI-Q podepsalo smlouvu o zřízení kvantového počítače v ČR

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Salesforce představuje Agentforce – AI nástroj pro budoucnost zákaznických služeb. Novinky v MSP platformě Acronis: Copilot a automatizované postupy odezvy. Třetina firem v ČR má téměř nulovou míru digitalizace. Objevili nový materiál pro opticky řízenou magnetickou paměť.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Třetina firem v ČR má téměř nulovou míru digitalizace

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Supravodivost: Popsali bohatý svět hydridů yttria. Supravodič zesílený magnetismem. Pro supravodivost hydridů by mohl být klíčový také cer. Dnešní podobu Sluneční soustavy mohla zformovat další hvězda.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Podařilo se vytvořit otisk zrcadel do superfotonu

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Když vidíte podobné ceny, při srovnání nákupu softwaru na oficiálních kanálech s Goodoffer24 se při tak velkém rozdílu nemůžete splést. Například u Windows 11 Pro je srovnání naprosto úžasné, protože srovnáváte částku €20 s tradiční cenou €259.
articles.title: Oficiální cena Windows 11 Pro je €259 avšak Goodoffer24 účtuje jen €20

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Chytré kamery umí předejít útokům se zbraní. Útočníka odhalí i v davu. Umělá inteligence pohání rostoucí investice do cloudových služeb PaaS a IaaS. Platforma RHEL AI podpoří podnikové inovace. AI patří i na notebooky. Bezserverová architektura není všelékem.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Bezserverová architektura není všelékem

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 37/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Zmapovali 50 000 záhadných uzlů DNA v lidském genomu. Kolik tak mohly vážit první hvězdy? Kabely pro jaderné elektrárny budou bezpečnější a vydrží déle.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Má smysl namísto života hledat ve vesmíru složitou chemii?

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přehled srpnových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za srpen 2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Patří datová centra do vesmíru? Acer představuje nové notebooky Swift Copilot+ s procesory Intel Core Ultra (Series 2). Kam míří automatizace sítí. Školy a univerzity stále více doplácejí na zanedbávání zranitelností. Kvantové počítače spolupracují s magnony.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Kvantové počítače spolupracují s magnony

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 36/2024

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byly publikovány informace o 4 kritických bezpečnostních chybách v CUPS (Common UNIX Printing System): CVE-2024-47176, CVE-2024-47076, CVE-2024-47175 a CVE-2024-47177. Vzdálený neověřený útočník může tiše nahradit adresy IPP stávajících tiskáren (nebo nainstalovat nové) za zlovolné, což může mít za následek spuštění libovolného příkazu (RCE) při spuštění tiskové úlohy.
articles.title: 4 kritické bezpečnostní chyby v CUPS

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Tcl/Tk, tj. programovací jazyk Tcl (Tool Command Language) a související GUI toolkit Tk, bylo vydáno v nové major verzi 9.0.0. Po 27 letech od vydání 8.0.0.
articles.title: Tcl/Tk 9.0.0

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Mastodon CZ Sraz 2024, tj. druhý ročník srazu uživatelů Mastodonu a Fediverse proběhne 11. října 2024 v Praze.
articles.title: Mastodon CZ Sraz 2024 - Praha

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Projekty Tor a Tails se spojují. Tails bude začleněn do struktury projektu Tor pro snazší spolupráci, lepší udržitelnost, snížení režie, rozšiřování povědomí o větším počtu digitálních hrozeb a lepší ochranu před sledováním a cenzurováním.
articles.title: Projekty Tor a Tails se spojují

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost System76 vydala druhou alfa verzi desktopového prostředí COSMIC Epoch 1 společně s alfa verzí Pop!_OS 24.04 LTS.
articles.title: 2. alfa verze desktopového prostředí COSMIC Epoch 1

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Byl vydán PostgreSQL 17. Přehled novinek v poznámkách k vydání.
articles.title: PostgreSQL 17

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Společnost Meta Platforms na své dvoudenní konferenci Meta Connect 2024 představuje novinky: brýle Orion (původně Project Nazare) pro rozšířenou realitu (AR, Augmented Reality), nový VR headset Meta Quest 3S, vylepšené chytré brýle Ray-Ban Meta nebo Llama 3.2, tj. nejnovější verzi svého velkého jazykového modelu.
articles.title: Meta Connect 2024

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Počítačová hra XBill (Wikipedie) oslavila v létě 30 let. V devadesátkách Linuxáci poctivě bránili Billovi v instalaci Windows. Bohužel hry XSteve a XSatya nevznikly. A nemáme ani hru XTim. Proto není Linux na desktopu tak rozšířený ☺. Mimochodem, po 25 letech byl aktualizován XBill pro PalmOS.
articles.title: XBill oslavil 30 let

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Počítačová hra Elite (Wikipedie), 3D vesmírní simulátor, byla vydána před 40 lety, 20. září 1984. Při té příležitosti byly zveřejněny další zdrojové kódy Elite pro platformy Apple, Atari, C64, NES a SNES a nedokončené Elite II pro BBC Micro.
articles.title: Počítačová hra Elite byla vydána před 40 lety

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: V květnu bylo oznámeno, že dnes budou zveřejněny zdrojové kódy přehrávače Winamp. Stalo se tak (𝕏). Zdrojové kódy jsou k dispozici na GitHubu. Nejedná se ale o svobodný a otevřený software (licence).
articles.title: Zdrojové kódy přehrávače Winamp zveřejněny

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: BusyBox 1.37 has been released as the first feature release in one and a half years for this "Swiss Army Knife of embedded Linux" systems.  With BusyBox 1.37 comes some new options, many fixes, and other enhancements...
articles.title: BusyBox 1.37 Adds "getfattr" Along With Other Improvements

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: There's been much speculation since this morning over a reported "severe" unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) flaw affecting Linux systems that carries a CVSS 9.9.9 score... The embargo has now lifted with the details on this nasty issue...
articles.title: Unauthenticated RCE Flaw With CVSS 9.9 Rating For Linux Systems Affects CUPS

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Earlier this week in the launch-day Intel Xeon 6980P Granite Rapids review/benchmarks I unfortunately wasn't able to provide any CPU power consumption and performance-per-Watt benchmarks due a Linux kernel issue and the minimal time ahead of launch for testing. I've now repeated the Xeon 6980P benchmarking on the Linux 6.8 kernel of Ubuntu 24.04 LTS with power monitoring working and have those power efficiency numbers to share today for how Granite Rapids compares to prior Emerald Rapids / Sapphire Rapids / Ice Lake and against the current AMD EPYC Bergamo/Genoa(X) competition.
articles.title: Intel Xeon 6980P vs. AMD EPYC Power Efficiency / Performance-Per-Watt Benchmarks

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: PostgreSQL 17 is out today as the newest annual feature release to this widely-used SQL database server. Notable with PostgreSQL 17 is having an AVX-512 optimized bit_count function along with several other heavy hitting performance optimizations...
articles.title: PostgreSQL 17 Released With AVX-512 Optimization & Up To 2x Better Write Throughput

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Following the release of the COSMIC Alpha desktop in early August, System76 is closing out September by issuing the second alpha release of their Rust-based open-source desktop environment...
articles.title: System76 Releases COSMIC Alpha 2 Desktop Packages

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The USB/Thunderbolt subsystem updates were submitted today for the Linux 6.12 kernel merge window along with the other areas of the kernel overseen by Greg Kroah-Hartman. A new USB driver is the 9p network gadget driver that has been in development for quite a while and aims to help ease embedded Linux device development...
articles.title: Linux 6.12 Brings 9p Network USB Gadget Driver To Ease Embedded Device Development

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The RISC-V architecture updates have been submitted for the Linux 6.12 kernel cycle. More RISC-V CPU ISA extensions are being supported along with enabling some additional kernel features for this CPU architecture...
articles.title: RISC-V Wires Up More Kernel Features With Linux 6.12

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The VirtIO Vsock guest/host communication interface using virtual sockets will see better performance with the in-development Linux 6.12 kernel...
articles.title: VirtIO Vsock Performance To Improve With Linux 6.12

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: It's been nearly three months since the last DXVK release for this Direct3D 8 / 9 / 10 / 11 implementation built atop Vulkan for Steam Play (Proton) / Wine. That changed today with  Philip Rebohle having just released DXVK 2.4.1...
articles.title: DXVK 2.4.1 Released With Many Improvements, More Robust Direct3D 8

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Vulkan 1.3.296 is out as the first spec update in nearly one month. Given the time that has passed there are more bug fixes than usual but there is also a prominent new extension: VK_EXT_device_generated_commands...
articles.title: Vulkan 1.3.296 Released With VK_EXT_device_generated_commands

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Valve open-source graphics software engineer Mike Blumenkrantz is well known in the Linux community for his work on the Zink OpenGL-on-Vulkan driver code, various Mesa driver optimizations, and creative writing on his blog. He's also taken up a new task: further accelerating Wayland protocol development...
articles.title: Valve Engineer Mike Blumenkrantz Hoping To Accelerate Wayland Protocol Development

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: ChipStar 1.2 has been released as the open-source software enabling HIP/CUDA programs to be compiled and run atop SPIR-V whether it be OpenCL or Vulkan drivers...
articles.title: ChipStar 1.2 Released For Compiling & Running HIP/CUDA On SPIR-V/OpenCL Hardware

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While Intel has been making steady progress around enhancing the Linux kernel handling for CPUs with a mix of P and E cores for proper task placement and power optimizations, one area that still is less than desirable for these hybrid Intel Core processors is around virtualization. But Intel engineers are now actively working on improving the Linux virtualization infrastructure for being able to convey the P/E core differences among vCPUs so that the guest VMs can better behave in such environments...
articles.title: Intel Working To Improve Virtualization Handling For P/E-Core Hybrid CPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Miguel Ojeda has submitted all of the Rust toolchain and infrastructure changes for the in-development Linux 6.12 kernel...
articles.title: Rust In Linux 6.12 Prepares For Rust Binder, Supports Sanitizers & CPU Mitigations

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Cloudflare's always-interesting technical blog laid out their details today concerning their next-gen "12th Generation" in-house servers that will be powering their vast web infrastructure. With these next-gen Cloudflare servers they are going with AMD EPYC 9684X Genoa-X processors...
articles.title: Cloudflare Goes With AMD EPYC Genoa-X For Their Next-Gen Servers

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Timothy Arceri with the Valve Linux graphics team has merged the code for Mesa GLSL to convert to NIR at compile-time and in turn dropping the old GLSL IR linker with this being a multi-year effort now wrapped up for Mesa 24.3...
articles.title: Mesa 24.3 Finishes The Years Long Effort To Phase Out The Old GLSL IR Linker

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Network File System (NFS) changes have been merged for the ongoing Linux 6.12 development cycle. Notable this time with NFS is adding LOCALIO protocol extension support that can lead to fairly "extreme" performance improvements in scenarios where the NFS client and server are on the same host...
articles.title: Linux 6.12 NFS Adds LOCALIO Protocol For "Extreme" Performance Boost

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Red Hat engineer Richard Hughes this morning released Fwupd 1.9.25 as the newest feature release to this open-source solution paired with the Linux Vendor Firmware Service (LVFS) for making firmware updates on Linux a breeze for an increasing number of systems and peripherals. With Fwupd 1.9.25, the supported device list has grown a little bit longer...
articles.title: Fwupd 1.9.25 Supports Firmware Updates For A Few More Devices Under Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The high performance open-source Mold linker has released version 2.34 with various improvements while also deciding to throw in the towel on DEC Alpha processor support...
articles.title: Mold Linker Decides To Drop DEC Alpha Support: Likely Broken & No Actual Users

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Joshua Ashton of Valve's Linux graphics team has opened a Mesa merge request to support a proposed "frog-fifo-v1" protocol for Wayland to address the matter of "FIFO is fundamentally broken under Mesa's Wayland WSI right now."..
articles.title: Frog-FIFO-V1 Aims To Address Mesa's "Fundamentally Broken" Wayland Code

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While there were many Windows reviews/benchmarks out Tuesday for Intel Core Ultra 200 Series "Lunar Lake" laptops on various websites, Linux tests are still awaiting due to having resorted to pre-ordering a Lunar Lake laptop myself for delivering Linux support/compatibility information and performance benchmarks. But hopefully by this time next week will be the initial data set...
articles.title: Intel Lunar Lake Linux Benchmarks Are Still Forthcoming

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: While open-source enthusiasts like to criticize NVIDIA for not maintaining upstream, in-tree kernel graphics driver support (though things have been changing there), for other areas of their vast hardware portfolio they are much better upstream Linux kernel citizens and often at the forefront of new driver innovations. One of the leading examples of that is around the NVIDIA Mellanox networking driver support. With Linux 6.12 they've landed a new feature that has been described as "a sign of things to come, I think we will see more of this in the next 10 years."..
articles.title: NVIDIA Mellanox Linux Driver Spearheads Multi-Path PCI As "A Sign Of Things To Come"

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: NVIDIA engineers have sent out an exciting set of Linux kernel patches for enabling NVIDIA vGPU software support for virtual GPU support among multiple virtual machines (VMs). In aiming for upstream-focused Linux support, this NVIDIA vGPU support is built around the adapted Nouveau driver with the code previously posted for splitting up the Nouveau/NVKM driver components...
articles.title: NVIDIA Publishes Open-Source Linux Driver Code For GPU Virtualization "vGPU" Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the Intel Xeon 6900P "Granite Rapids" launch today the review embargo has now expired. I began with my Intel Granite Rapids Linux benchmarking a few days ago and have initial benchmarks to share for the flagship Xeon 6980P processors paired with MRDIMM 8800MT/s memory. This is just the beginning of a lot of Granite Rapids benchmarks to come on Phoronix. Compared to the existing AMD EPYC competition and prior generation Intel Xeon processors, the Xeon 6900P series performance surpassed my expectations and has debuted as an incredibly strong performer. In some areas of HPC and other workloads, Intel is able to regain leadership performance with Granite Rapids paired with MRDIMMs. In AI workloads where the software is optimized for AMX, the new Xeon 6900P CPUs can showcase staggering leads.
articles.title: Intel Xeon 6980P "Granite Rapids" Linux Benchmarks

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Building off the launch earlier this year of the first Xeon 6 processors with the Xeon 6700E "Sierra Forest" processors, today Intel is lifting the wraps on the much anticipated Xeon 6900P "Granite Rapids" processors. Where as Sierra Forest is optimized for power efficiency and core density, the Intel Xeon 6 P-core processors are optimized for per-core performance and have shown some very strong generational uplift -- and against the AMD competition -- as we'll show today in the first Xeon 6980P Linux benchmarks.
articles.title: Intel Launches Xeon 6900P Series "Granite Rapids" Processors

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel used their Enterprise Tech Tour last week in Oregon to not only provide insight into the new Xeon 6900 "Granite Rapids" server processors (and Xeon 6980P benchmarks) but also to shed more light on their Gaudi 3 AI inference accelerator. The question I was most curious about with Gaudi 3: where's the Linux driver support?..
articles.title: Intel Gaudi 3 Linux Driver Support Expected Next Month

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Merged as part of the memory management "MM" changes for the Linux 6.12 kernel is a kernel stack usage histogram to help developers in better optimizing the kernel stack sizes and minimizing memory waste...
articles.title: Linux 6.12 Adds A Kernel Stack Usage Histogram To Help With Optimizations

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Going along with other early Linux kernel driver additions for enabling Panther Lake, the intel-lpss driver in Linux 6.12 has made its device ID additions for supporting Panther Lake H and Panther Lake P processors...
articles.title: Intel LPSS Driver Adds Panther Lake Support In Linux 6.12

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Intel LPMD open-source project is a user-space daemon for optimizing active idle power handling on Linux and can be useful particularly for modern Intel Core hybrid processors. LPMD is short for the "Low Power Mode Daemon" while with today's v0.0.7 release it's now re-identified itself as the "Energy Optimizer" instead...
articles.title: Intel's LPMD "Low Power Mode Daemon" Now Identifies As The "Energy Optimizer"

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Landlock as the Linux security module for unprivileged access control handling is adding new controls around Unix socket handling with the Linux 6.12 kernel...
articles.title: Landlock Sandboxing Now Supports More Controls Around Unix Sockets

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Dell-WMI-Sysman driver on Linux allows for managing BIOS settings from within Linux using sysfs. This dell-wmi-sysman kernel driver supports most Dell platforms from 2018 and newer for convenient BIOS management...
articles.title: Dell-WMI-Sysman Linux Driver Being Extended For Alienware Systems

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: The Flash-Friendly File-System (F2FS) updates have been submitted for the Linux 6.12 merge window...
articles.title: F2FS With Linux 6.12 Converts I/O Paths To Use Folios, Other Improvements

The Legendary Brawler, Kenji, has sliced his way over to Brawl Stars, expanding the dynamic Assassin class. While he's already a formidable fighter, the potential of a well-crafted build can elevate his performance to new heights. Here's how to create the best Kenji build in Brawl Stars.


What is the best build for Kenji in Brawl Stars?


The premium store lets you unlock Kenji early, ahead of his free-to-play launch around Oct. 3. Equip the following items to get the best Kenji build in Brawl Stars:



Gadget: Hosomaki Healing


Star Power: Nigiri Nemesis


Gear: Damage


Gear 2: Gadget Charge 



When comparing Kenji's two Gadgets, the Hosomaki Healing is the clear choice. It'll provide you with 75 percent healing for over three seconds, giving you a second chance even if your health is low. You'll improve his survivability further using the Nigiri Nemesis. The Star Power offers a 90 percent damage reduction with the next enemy attack. But, you must avoid damage for five seconds in exchange for the ability.


The Gadget and Star Power almost make Kenji feel like an unstoppable force. And it'll get even better once you place some Gear on him. Since we've mainly tackled Kenji's defensive capacity, it's time to enhance his attacks.


Screenshot by Destructoid


Use the Damage Gear to gain 15 percent extra damage any time his health is 50 percent. Last but not least is the Gadget Charge, increasing the usage of the Hosomaki Healing during a match. You could also go for Speed instead to make him run faster. Of course, the choice is entirely up to you, so utilize the Gear items that better suit your playstyle.


Before you step onto the battlefield, test out this Brawl Stars Kenji build in the Practice Match or Training Grounds. Then, you can start dominating the leaderboards with his trusty sword. If you want to try out more characters, be sure to check out our builds for Moe and Frank.

articles.author: Tiago Manuel
articles.description:
In a recent talk with director Alex Garland for Famitsu that got caught by Automaton Media, Hideo Kojima spilled a few interesting details about the upcoming Death Stranding movie adaptation.


“Many of the offers I received [for Death Stranding’s movie adaptation] from other film companies proposed big-budget adaptations with extravagant explosions, but I didn’t want that. Together with A24, I want to make a slightly different film,” Kojima stated.


Death Stranding is being co-produced by A24, an entertainment company with a varied filmography under its belt. So far, it has been behind titles including Ex Machina, The VVitch, Pearl, Hereditary, and Best Picture Oscar winner Everything Everywhere All At Once. 


On top of the studio's eclecticism that Kojima will surely use to let his imagination go wild, A24 is also a company known for doing a lot with little.




Still, Kojima had some apprehensions. “With Civil War becoming a huge hit, I have a feeling that A24 is raising the budget and scale [of Death Stranding], so I’m thinking about how to suppress that.”


Either way, Kojima stated that A24 has a unique presence in the industry, one that aligns with the vision of Kojima Productions, saying, “it will take time, but it will turn out well.” He also joked that A24 is probably the right choice, as his birthday is on August 24.


Kojima wanted to make it in movies before pivoting to the video game industry, and while he could have used this opportunity to finally jump in the director's seat, he decided to stick to a producer role. We still don't know who'll direct Death Stranding or when it'll come out, but, funnily enough, it'll likely see the light of day before the Metal Gear Solid movie adaptation. 


As for the game sequel, Death Stranding 2: On The Beach, is set to release sometime in 2025.

The post Death Stranding movie won’t be an explosion-filled blockbuster appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Death Stranding movie won’t be an explosion-filled blockbuster

articles.author: Joseph Luster
articles.description:
If you've been on the Internet at all, you've seen the "This is Fine" dog, also known as Question Hound. KC Green (Gunshow, HE IS A GOOD BOY) is the artist behind it, and he just launched a crowdfunding campaign for Question Hound's very own platformer.


The Kickstarter for the appropriately titled This is Fine: Maximum Cope went live earlier today with a goal of US$50,000. The campaign video includes some footage of the platformer in action, but Green is quick to remind everyone that the assets and video are in the early prototype stage. Still, it already has some cute animations and you can kind of see what they're going for in the video below. 




This is Fine: Maximum Cope has players traversing worlds based on very real anxieties, including Humiliation, Fear, Failure, Loss, and Regret. In addition to taking on enemies that embody everyday worries, you'll have to face off against larger Anxiety Bosses. Defeating them and capturing their essence in a Worry-Box will net you new abilities that help Question Hound head into new areas.


Speaking of the dog at the center of it all, most of his abilities so far have to do with his trusty hat. He can toss it, shrink it small enough to fit inside it, and even use it as a boat. He can also use his tail as a helicopter and fire off a bark blast. 


No really, this is fine! 


Screenshot via Kickstarter Campaign


KC Green is working with Numskull Games on this one. Reward tiers include a digital copy of the game, the physical release, a collector's edition, t-shirt bundle, and so on. The "Big One" is a $1,500 tier that includes everything else plus an in-game cameo featuring Green's illustration of you. 


This will probably be fully funded in the coming hours. When This is Fine: Maximum Cope eventually launches — it's currently eyeing a March 2026 delivery — it should be available on PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, and Steam. 

The post ‘This is Fine’ dog gets his own platformer from original creator KC Green appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: ‘This is Fine’ dog gets his own platformer from original creator KC Green

articles.description:
The Early Access launch of Throne and Liberty is here, but a pesky bug is preventing some users from being able to play. Despite being released, you may experience a bug where the Grey Play Button on Steam is unclickable, and therefore you cannot play. Here is how to fix the Throne and Liberty 'Grey Play Button' bug.


Screenshot by Destructoid


What to do if you can't click the Play button


For some players, the play button for Throne and Liberty is grayed out and not clickable. Furthermore, if you check in the Downloads section on Steam, it shows the MMORPG as Unscheduled but when you try to click to manually download, it says Game Not Released. Unfortunately, this appears to be a launch-time bug that is affecting a small set of players. Amazon has confirmed the issue is a bug and that they are currently working to get a fix out ASAP for the issue.


While awaiting the bug fix, some players have had success by trying the following fixes for the 'Grey Play Button' bug on Throne and Liberty:



Go Offline then back Online on Steam. Do this by clicking the Steam menu button in the top left and then going to 'Go Offline...'.


Restart Steam. Make sure you close out of Steam completely, then relaunch it in Administrator Mode.


Verify File Integrity. Right-click on Throne and Liberty in your Library then go to Properties. Next, click Installed Files on the left, then Verify Integrity of Game Files.


Uninstall and Reinstall Throne and Liberty. Make sure the game is completely uninstalled before reinstalling it via Steam.



The main issue with this bug is that it does not allow you to unpack the Throne and Liberty game files, therefore you can't launch or even create a shortcut for the game. If you're able to get to the step of unpacking, the play button will become clickable.

The post How to fix Throne and Liberty ‘Grey Play Button’ bug appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to fix Throne and Liberty ‘Grey Play Button’ bug

Topaz in Disney Dreamlight Valley can help you finish certain quests and gain a lot of Star Coins. They're mined from stones in a familiar area of the game; here's where to find them.


Topaz Disney Dreamlight Valley location


Topaz is a rare crystal that can be obtained by mining rocks in The Plaza. This is the first location you visit in the game in front of the castle. Topaz is yellow, so if you see a rock gleaming in that color, go mine it. 


Screenshot by Destructoid


There is a chance it appears without the crystal popping out, but it's far less likely. Keep trying if you don't find Topaz in your first run of mining. Wait five minutes, and then the rocks should reappear. I had to do this four or five times before one emerged. You may find Garnet, which is red, as well. It can be frustrating, but keep going, and you'll find Topaz eventually.


Mulan is one of the quest givers who want three Topaz from you with the A Daily Regime quest. Thankfully, Garnet is another crystal she'd love; she'll ask for six. She'll also need four Aquamarine and six Peridots. Aquamarine crystals can be mined at Dazzle Beach and the Forest of Valor. Peridots are obtained by mining rocks in Dazzle Beach and the Peaceful Meadow. 


What is Topaz sold for in Disney Dreamlight Valley?


Topaz can be sold for 240 Star Coins at Goofy's Stalls. They're mostly valuable when quests are involved, but hey, it's something.
